gurmukhi: ਹਮ ਨਹੀ ਤਯਾਗਤ ਬਾਜ ਬਰ ਸੁਣਿ ਲਛਮਨਾ ਕੁਮਾਰ ॥ ਅਪਨੋ ਭਰ ਬਲ ਜੁੱਧ ਕਰ ਅਬ ਹੀ ਸੰਕ ਬਿਸਾਰ ॥੭੫੧॥
transliteration: Ham Nahityaagad Baaj Bar Soun(i) Lachhmanaa Koumaar|| Apno Bhar Bal Juddh Kar Ab Hisank Bisaar||751||
translation: The boys said, “O Lakshman ! we shall not unfasten the horse, abandoning all your doubts you come forward to fight with all your might.”751.

gurmukhi: ਲਛਮਨ ਗੱਜਯੋ ॥ ਬਡ ਧਨ ਸੱਜਯੋ ॥ ਬਹੁ ਸਰ ਛੋਰੇ ॥ ਜਣ ਘਣ ਓਰੇ ॥੭੫੨॥
transliteration: Lachhman Gadjyo|| Bad Dhan Sajjyo|| Bahu Sar Chore|| Jan Ghan Ore||752||
translation: Catching hold of his very huge bow Lakshman thundering like clouds, showered a volley of arrows.752.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਤ ਦਿਵ ਦੇਖੈਂ ॥ ਧਨੁ ਧਨੁ ਲੇਖੈਂ ॥ ੲਿਤ ਸਰ ਛੋਰੇ ॥ ਮਸ ਕਣ ਤੂਟੈਂ ॥੭੫੩॥
transliteration: Out Div Dekhain|| Dhan(u) Dhan(u) Lekhain|| It Sar Chhodhtain|| Mas Kan Tootain||753||
translation: From the other side the gods are seeing the war and the sound of “Bravo, Bravo” is being heard. On this side the arrows are being discharged and bits of flesh are being chopped.753.

gurmukhi: ਭਟ ਬਰ ਗਾਜੈਂ ॥ ਦੁੰਦਭ ਬਾਜੈਂ ॥ ਸਰਬਰ ਛੋਰੈਂ ॥ ਮੁਖ ਨਹ ਮੋਰੈਂ ॥੭੫੪॥
transliteration: Bhat Bar Gadjain|| Doundabh Baajain|| Sarbar Chhodhain|| Moukh Nah Morain||754||
translation: The warriors are thundering, the drums are resounding, the arrows are being discharge, but still they are not retreating from the war-arena.754.
The speech of Lakshman addressed to the boys :

gurmukhi: ਸ੍ਰਿਣ ਸ੍ਰਿਣ ਲਰਕਾ ॥ ਜਿਨ ਕਰ ਕਰਖਾ ॥ ਦੇ ਮਿਲਿ ਘੋਰਾ ॥ ਤੁਹਿ ਬਲ ਥੋਰਾ ॥੭੫੫॥
transliteration: Srin Srin Larkaa|| Jin Kar Karkhaa|| De Mil(i) Ghoraa|| Tuh(i) Bal Thoraa||755||
translation: “O boys ! listen and do not wage the war, meet me while bringing the horse, because you have inadequate strength.755.

gurmukhi: ਹਠ ਤਜਿ ਅੱੲੀਅੈ ॥ ਜਿਨ ਸਮੁਹੱੲੀਅੈ ॥ ਮਿਲਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਮੋ ਕੋ ॥ ਡਰ ਨਹੀਂ ਤੋ ਕੋ ॥੭੫੬॥
transliteration: Hath Taj(i) Aee-ai|| Jin Samuhaee-ai|| Mil(i) Mil(i) Mo Ko|| Dar Naheen To Ko||756||
translation: “Come after forsaking your persistence and do not confront me, have no fear, come and meet me.”756.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਸ ਨਹੀ ਮਾਨੀ ॥ ਅਤਿ ਅਭਿਮਾਨੀ ॥ ਗਹਿ ਧਨੁ ਗੱਜਯੋ ॥ ਦੁ ਪਗ ਨ ਭੱਜਯੋ ॥੭੫੭॥
transliteration: Sis Nahimaanee|| At(i) Abhimaanee|| Gad(i) Dhan(u) Gadjyo|| Du Pag Na Bhajjyo||757||
translation: The boys did not agree because they were proud their strength, they caught hold of their bows and roared and did not retrace even two steps.757.

gurmukhi: ਰੁੱਪੇ ਰਣ ਭਾੲੀ ॥ ਸਰ ਝੜ ਲਾੲੀ ॥ ਬਰਖੇ ਬਾਣੰ ॥ ਪਰਖੇ ਜੁਅਾਣੰ ॥੭੫੮॥
transliteration: Ruddhe Ran Bhaaee|| Sar Jhad Leeaa|| Barkhe Baanan|| Parkhe Juaanan||758||
translation: Both the brother were absorbed in war and showering their arrows, they tested the strength of the soldiers.758.

gurmukhi: ਡਿੱਗੇ ਰਣ ਮੱਧੰ ॥ ਅੱਧੋ ਅੱਧੰ ॥ ਕੱਟੇ ਅੰਗੰ ॥ ਰੁੱਝੇ ਜੰਗੰ ॥੭੫੯॥
transliteration: Digge Ran Maddhan|| Addho Addhan|| Katte Anadg|| Rujjhe Janadg||759||
translation: The warriors fell in the battlefield being chopped into bits, and the limbs of the fighting soldiers were cut.759.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਣਨ ਝੜ ਲਾਯੋ ॥ ਸਰਬ ਰਸਾਯੋ ॥ ਬਹੁ ਅਰ ਮਾਰੇ ॥ ਡੀਲ ਡਰਾਰੇ ॥੭੬੦॥
transliteration: Baanan Jhad Laayo|| Sarab Rasaayo|| Bahu Ar Mdare|| Deel Dardare||760||
translation: The pools of blood waved with the shower of arrows; many enemies were killed and many were filled with fear.760.
